forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
It seems default initrd in server installs do not support iso-scan/filename kernel parameter and the functionality to search and use an ISO file during setup. However, the ones in hd-media images do support it. The solution is to create several folders for each version, put ISO file in each and add the hd-media kernel and initrd file for the corresponding version. Here is how for ubuntu-12.04-server-i386.iso: Put the ISO file in /Ubuntu_i386_12.04/ folder. Download the corresponding vmlinuz and initrd.gz files from : [http://archive.ubunt...mages/hd-media/](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/precise/main/installer-i386/current/images/hd-media/ "External link") [http://archive.ubunt...media/initrd.gz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/precise/main/installer-i386/current/images/hd-media/initrd.gz "External link") [http://archive.ubunt...d-media/vmlinuz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/precise/main/installer-i386/current/images/hd-media/vmlinuz "External link") Amend menu.lst: ``` title INSTALL UBUNTU SERVER 12.04 32BIT find --set-root /Ubuntu_i386_12.04/ubuntu-12.04-server-i386.iso kernel /Ubuntu_i386_12.04/vmlinuz file=/cdrom/preseed/ubuntu-server.seed noprompt boot=install only-ubiquity iso-scan/filename=/Ubuntu_i386_12.04/ubuntu-12.04-server-i386.iso quiet splash -- initrd /Ubuntu_i386_12.04/initrd.gz ```
Similarly for the other versions. Here are the files needed for the other versions: [https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Releases](https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Releases "External link") **12.04 AMD64** : [http://archive.ubunt...media/initrd.gz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/precise/main/installer-amd64/current/images/hd-media/initrd.gz "External link") [http://archive.ubunt...d-media/vmlinuz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/precise/main/installer-amd64/current/images/hd-media/vmlinuz "External link") **11.10 i386** : [http://archive.ubunt...media/initrd.gz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/oneiric/main/installer-i386/current/images/hd-media/initrd.gz "External link") [http://archive.ubunt...d-media/vmlinuz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/oneiric/main/installer-i386/current/images/hd-media/vmlinuz "External link") **11.10 AMD64** : [http://archive.ubunt...media/initrd.gz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/oneiric/main/installer-amd64/current/images/hd-media/initrd.gz "External link") [http://archive.ubunt...d-media/vmlinuz](http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/oneiric/main/installer-amd64/current/images/hd-media/vmlinuz "External link") Or put all files in one folder, rename initrd.gz and vmlinuz to a unique name matching the version and amend menu.lst to reflect the changes in file names and location.

forumNotes.author: ilko
forumNotes.content:
Tested 11.10 32 bits, same result. It seems installer scripts correctly find the ISO by searching for all available ISO files (iso-scan/filename seems like being ignored), detects it's the correct version and is usable, but for some reason does not use it afterwards.  

[![Posted Image](http://i.imgur.com/VkNkP.jpg)](http://imgur.com/VkNkP "External link")  

I don't know why, missing kernel parameter, bug in this version..., no idea.  

If anyone is interested, the script which searches for ISO files is in /var/lib/dpkg/info/iso-scan.postinst in the initrd file.
